quotes.quote: There is an art to eavesdropping, but I think to some extent we are all guilty of picking up those little odds and ends that can be quite intriguing if you analyse them.
There's nothing like eavesdropping to show you that the world outside your head is different from the world inside your head.
The key to good eavesdropping is not getting caught.
Any place is good for eavesdropping, if you know how to eavesdrop.
Eavesdropping's a sin, but ignorance is fatal. Take your pick.
I shouldn't have eavesdropped, but sometimes, that's the only way to find out the truth.
Nothing good was ever learned from eavesdropping, so mind your business and let others mind theirs.
Eavesdropping's sort of thrilling 'cause you learn what people really think, but eavesdropping makes you miserable for exactly the same reason.
A writer's occupational hazard: I think of eavesdropping as minding my business.
Spying is a like a game of chess: Sometimes you have to withdraw, sometimes you have to sacrifice one of your pieces to win - preferably a knight rather than a king or queen.
Eavesdropping is a deplorable habit, but I have developed worse ones since.
The first rule of snooping is to come at it sideways.

The end and aim of spying in all its five varieties is knowledge of the enemy; and this knowledge can only be derived, in the first instance, from the converted spy. Hence it is essential that the converted spy be treated with the utmost liberality.
I do love to eavesdrop. It's inspirational, not only for subject matter but for actual dialogue, the way people talk.
If you could eavesdrop on everything said about you, you'd spend most of your time waiting for the subject to come up.
Eavesdropping is such a regular-person activity.
We're no longer in the Cold War. Eavesdropping on friends is unacceptable.
Spying on people by magic is the same as spying on them in any other way.
The first step in good reporting is good snooping.
Spying among friends is never acceptable.
Spying is always an expensive method of acquiring information.
There's been spying for years, there's been surveillance for years, and so forth, I'm not going to pass judgement on that, it's the nature of our society.
Every time you overhear something hurtful, I want you to do something kind for someone else.
